name: Velvet Mesquite
summary: Iconic desert tree with deep tap roots. Historically important food source for indigenous peoples.
description: Velvet Mesquite trees are remarkably adapted to desert life, with root systems that can extend 100 feet deep to reach underground water sources. These trees provide critical shade and habitat for desert wildlife. The seed pods were a staple food for Native American tribes, ground into flour for bread and cakes. The wood is prized for its aromatic smoke in barbecue cooking and its beautiful grain in woodworking.
safety: Watch for thorns on branches. Some individuals may be allergic to mesquite pollen during spring blooming season.
fun_fact: A single mesquite tree can produce up to 400 pounds of nutritious pods in a good year, with pods containing up to 25% protein.
